result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Kirschbaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court, in custody with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Terry heard, this is hearing regarding motion to revoke DPA, will not contest State's request. Court questions Def. who responds/agrees w/ what Atty Terry stated. Court heard, grants motion from State to revoke DPA. Court questions Atty Terry, who believes State will be requesting a PSI; Def. will not be contesting that either. Discussion held regarding other cases assigned to Branch 3 and on need for PSI. Atty Klomberg heard, requests the PSI. Court heard, will order PSI.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Treatment Court Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 12:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Intern, Joe Andreoni also apprs for State of Wisconsin.  DEF will be pleading to Ct 1 with Ct 2 to be dismissed/read in.  Parties reached agreement with sentencing to be held out 12 months.  DEF approved for TAD Program.  If successfully completes, State will not recomm prison sentence.  DEF currently on probation.  Court reviews agreement with DEF.  Charges and penalties reviewed with DEF and understands.  DEF enters no contest plea.  PQWOR filed/reviewed.  State asks to rely on criminal complaint.  Atty Terry stips.  Court finds factual basis.  Court reviews previous offense/finds DEF repeator.  Court finds plea was made FVKI and accepts plea and finds DEF guilty as repeator.

9:04 - Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. New address on 1/6/16 - 117 E South St, Beaver Dam WI. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $250 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
